info.description:
This REST API document is new for Release 12.

Representational State Transfer (REST) APIs and Atom feeds are available to support integration requirements for the common features in Oracle Applications Cloud. The REST APIs enable easy integration of data into new and existing business process flows. Atom feeds enable easy tracking of changes made to feed-enabled resources.
info.title: REST API for Common Features in Oracle Applications Cloud Release 12
info.x-summary: This REST API document is new for Release 12.

itemsPerPage.description: The number of resource instances returned in the current range.

startIndex.description: This parameter defines the starting position in the resource collection. For example, if startIndex is 11 and itemsPerPage is 10, the response body contains rows from 11 to 20.
startIndex.title: StartIndex

Resources.description: The user resources in the collection.
Resources.title: Resources

id.description: A unique identifier for the user resource in Oracle Applications Cloud.
id.title: Id

meta.description: The metadata of the user resource.
meta.title: Meta

schemas.description: The schema of the user resource.
schemas.title: Schemas

userName.description: A unique identifier for the user to authenticate with the service provider directly. This attribute is required.
userName.title: UserName

name.title: Name
name.description: The components of the user's name. This attribute may return:Full name as a single string Individual component attributes Both variants. The  formatted version indicates how the component attributes are combined so that both variants describe the same name.

displayName.description: The display name of the user, usually the full name.
displayName.title: DisplayName

emails.description: The e-mail addresses of the user. The service provider uses canonical form of these addresses, for example, bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical type values are work, home, and other.
emails.title: Emails

roles.description: The list of roles for users in Oracle Applications Cloud.
roles.title: Roles

active.description: Indicates the administrative status of the user. The service provider determines the definitive value for this attribute. For example, true indicates that the user is able to login, and false indicates that the user account is suspended.
active.title: Active

password.description: The clear text password of the user. This attribute is used to specify an initial password for new users and to reset password for existing users. The password attribute is never returned in response to a query.
password.title: Password

id.description: A list of ids for the roles that a user can belong to, through direct membership.
id.title: Id

value.description: A list of values for the roles.
value.title: Value

displayName.description: The display name of the role.
displayName.title: DisplayName

value.description: The e-mail addresses of the user. The service provider uses canonical form of these addresses, for example, bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical type values are work, home, and other.
value.title: Value

type.description: The type of e-mail id, which is hard coded to work.
type.title: Type

primary.description: Indicates that this e-mail id is the primary address. This value is hard coded to true.
primary.title: Primary

familyName.description: The last name of the user.
familyName.title: FamilyName

givenName.description: The first name of the user.
givenName.title: GivenName

startIndex.title: start index

schemas.title: Schemas

id.description: The unique identifier of the schema in Oracle Applications Cloud.
id.title: Id

mutability.description: The mutability of the attribute. The default value is readWrite.
mutability.title: Mutability

multiValued.description: Indicates whether the attribute contains multiple values, for example multiple email ids. The default value is false.
multiValued.title: MultiValued

required.description: Indicates whether the attribute is required. The default value is false.
required.title: Required

caseExact.description: Indicates whether the attribute name is case sensitive. The default value is false.
caseExact.title: CaseExact

returned.description: Specifies whether the attribute value is returned in response to a query. The default value is default to indicate that the attribute value is returned.
returned.title: Returned

uniqueness.description: Specifies the uniqueness of the attribute value. The default value is none to indicate that the values are not unique.
uniqueness.title: Uniqueness

mutability.description: The mutability of the sub-attribute. The default value is readWrite.
mutability.title: Mutability

multiValued.description: Indicates whether the sub-attribute contains multiple values. The default value is false.
multiValued.title: MultiValued

required.description: Indicates whether the sub-attribute is required. The default value is false.
required.title: Required

caseExact.description: Indicates whether the sub-attribute name is case sensitive. The default value is false.
caseExact.title: CaseExact

tags.name: Audit Report
tags.description: The audit report resource is used to get audit history of the business objects and middleware components.

tags.name: Bulk
tags.description: The bulk operation is used to send a large collection of resource operations in a single request. The body of a bulk operation contains a set of HTTP resource operations using any of the supported HTTP methods for Users and Roles resources. The supported HTTP methods for the bulk operation include POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE. Each bulk job can have multiple operations per resource. It may be beneficial to perform the bulk job in batches, for example 50 operations per batch.

tags.name: Resource Types
tags.description: The resource type resource is used to view the supported resource types and their meta data.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: The roles resource is used to add, view, or delete membership to roles in Oracle Applications Cloud. You can also view the users assigned to each role.

tags.name: Schemas
tags.description: The scheme resource is used to view the attribute definitions of the System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) resources.

tags.name: User Requests
tags.description: The userRequest resource publishes an atom entry when a user is created, updated, activated, disabled, or deleted in Oracle Applications Cloud.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: The user resource is used to create, update, delete, or view users in Oracle Applications Cloud.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

200.description: The following table describes the response for this task.

filter.name: filter
filter.description: This parameter specifies the query expression to retrieve a subset of user resource instances. Format: ?filter=<scim-filter>  Example: filter=firstName pr and userType eq Employee

startIndex.name: startIndex
startIndex.description: This parameter specifies use of 1-based index for the first result included in the response. Specify this query parameter to use pagination.

count.name: count
count.description: This parameter specifies the number of resource instances to be returned in the current range.

sortBy.name: sortBy
sortBy.description: This parameter specifies the attributes based on which the resource collection is sorted.Format:  ?sortBy=<scim-attribute> where the attribute name must be of the format <attribute> for simple attributes and <attribute.subattribute> for complex attributes. Example: sortBy=active

sortOrder.name: sortOrder
sortOrder.description: This parameter specifies the attributes based on which the resource collection is ordered. Example: sortOrder=ascending

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: This parameter specifies a comma-separated list of attribute values to be included in the response.

fromDate.name: fromDate
fromDate.description: The date from which the audit history is to be retrieved. The format of the date can be yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss. You can retrieve audit history for up to one month.

toDate.name: toDate
toDate.description: The date up to which the audit report data is to be retrieved. The format of the date can be yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

user.name: user
user.description: The display name of the user.

product.name: product
product.description: A predefined product value provided in the request. The valid values are available in the FND_AUDIT_WEBAPP_AM table.

eventType.name: eventType
eventType.description: A comma-separated list of events you want to search.

businessObjectType.name: businessObjectType
businessObjectType.description: The fully qualified view object name.

includeChildObjects.name: includeChildObjects
includeChildObjects.description: Indicates whether to include the child objects in the audit report. The default value is false.

includeImpersonator.name: includeImpersonator
includeImpersonator.description: Indicates whether to include the impersonator name in the audit report. The default value is false.

includeExtendedObjectIdentiferColumns.name: includeExtendedObjectIdentiferColumns
includeExtendedObjectIdentiferColumns.description: Indicates whether to include the context information for the business objects. The default value is false.

includeAttributes.name: includeAttributes
includeAttributes.description: Indicates whether the audit report includes attribute details that were changed in the specified time period. The default value is true.

attributeDetailMode.name: attributeDetailMode
attributeDetailMode.description: Indicates whether the old and new attribute values are returned. If true, the old and new values are retrieved. If false, the response contains only attribute names, and not old and new values. The default value is false.

timeZone.name: timeZone
timeZone.description: The timezone to be used for the specified period of the audit report. The valid values are availbale in the FND_TIMEZONES_VL view.

managedApp.name: managedApp
managedApp.description: This is to filter the OPSS data based on managed application name. Comma separated values can be passed.

pageNumber.name: pageNumber
pageNumber.description: The page number in the audit report you want to view.

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The number of records displayed in a page, in the audit report.
